reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: I've bought 12 TP-Link smart light switches over the past 3-4 years. Two weeks ago, one just stopped working. I figured, okay, stuff happens. But then—boom—another one dies the following week. The day after that? A third one goes out. That’s three failures in under two weeks. Out of curiosity, I checked TP-Link’s website. Surprise, surprise: the warranty is only 1–2 years. Guess what? All three failed right after the warranty expired. These things aren’t defective — they’re engineered to fail once you’re no longer covered. That’s not a coincidence. That’s a planned-obsolescence scam. These smart switches are not “smart”—they’re a stupid waste of money. Regular light switches last 10–20 years, while these overpriced plastic toys can’t even last two. DO NOT BUY these switches. I don’t care how fancy the app is or what brand it is — TP-Link or otherwise. If it needs replacing every couple of years, it’s trash. Stick with old-school switches. They’re cheap, reliable, and they don’t leave you in the dark — literally.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2025
reviews.title: TP-Link Smart Switches Are Garbage – Built to Break, Total Scam

Sometimes the switch won't work manually. Come prepared with an extra level of patience to deal with this set up. I still haven't been able to get it to operate as expected.

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: First issue, had these been labeled as "frequently returned" when I purchased them like they are now, I wouldn't have. This message didn't appear for me until after I had and installed them then proceeded to waste time discovering the quirks for myself. The switches themselves work well enough, however the entire reason I purchased these is for compatibility with my Home Assistant based smart home. These will not work without using the KASA or other cloud based apps and what I want is something compatible with my locally hosted Home Assistant. Since I have other KASA products, I mistakenly purchased these thinking they were Matter compatible, but they are not. All my other KASA switches use Matter so it was an easy mistake to make. Problem two is they don't reliably report their status to the KASA app which defeats the purpose of using the app in the first place. This is a problem since I don't want multiple cloud based apps that don't mingle controlling devices for my smart home. This means everything must be separate or I have to stay in one ecosystem and can't take advantage of the best products from whoever makes them. The positives: the installation was easy and I like the touch style switches. I like the halo when the switch is off and how they match other switches in the house. I also like that regardless of which switch was used to control the light, they both look the same. Two switches in different positions to control the same light / device is one of my annoyances with a 3-way light setup using typical north American lever switches.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2025
reviews.title: Little frustrated.

I paid for an electrician to come behind me and see what I'm doing wrong and he couldn't get this one to work either. Said it was just "confusing" I love the other kasa switches, but this one just doesn't seem to hit the mark.

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: This product worked perfectly, once it was installed correctly! Connecting this to the Neutral is key and making sure you identify the Neutral is imperative. When I opened up the electrical box that had 3 total switches, I only opened up the far left box. That was the one I was replacing with this product. I saw a gray wire, which can sometimes represent the Neutral, so I connected the white wire from this Kasa switch to that gray wire. When I flipped the breaker on, it just tripped immediately. Upon further review, I read that sometimes, the Neutrals are just sort of placed in the back of the electrical box...out of the way. So I then took off the remaining 2 light switches and sure enough, tucked away in the back right were white wires...all twisted together with the wire nut. I found the neturals! After some maneuvering, I connected the Kasa white neutral to the neutrals in the box...flipped the breaker and everything worked. Setup was a breeze and I'm really loving the "vacation" feature to make it seem like we're home when we're not. Any deterrence is good deterrence! And to confirm, I only swapped out ONE of the three-way switches. I still have traditional toggle on the other side of the garage where we installed this. So no need to install BOTH switches for one 3-way switch light. Highly recommend and I may now have to swap out more smart switches in the house!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2025
reviews.title: Works perfectly! Make sure to find the NEUTRAL wire! :)

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: Love these smarts switches! Why? Because they just work! Power outages, wifi problems, you name it as soon as they are able, they reconnect and just work as if nothing happened. I have over 20 of these installed in my house and have been totally trouble free since the spring of 2022. I have had them tied to google home and Alexa through multiple accounts it has been totally seamless. However, If I am being critical I would point out the mechanical side of the switch feels somewhat cheap and doesn't not give a satisfying click when pressed. Also the switch is quite bulky on the backside make sure you have plenty of space in your switch boxes, making room for this extra bulk is the most time consuming and tedious part of the install if your boxes are already crowded
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2025
reviews.title: They just work!

If I turn off the lights at the front door, I can’t turn them back on with the switch near the hallway. I have to use the one by the front door again. Voice commands will not work if I turned the lights off on one switch and then try to turn them on with the other switch. It disables the entire thing.

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: I’ve been using Kasa smart switches and the Deco TP-Link A5400 mesh WiFi for over two years, and overall, I’m extremely disappointed. Despite both products being from the same brand, the Kasa app is consistently laggy, slow, and unreliable. Even with a strong network connection, the app struggles to respond, making smart home control frustrating. The biggest issue is connectivity. The Deco A5400 mesh system itself has been unstable, frequently dropping connections or failing to properly integrate with Kasa devices. I’ve tried every troubleshooting method—resetting, repositioning nodes, firmware updates—but nothing has provided a long-term fix. To make matters worse, Google Home integration is unreliable at best, with devices often appearing offline or responding inconsistently to voice commands. For a smart home ecosystem, reliability is crucial, and TP-Link has not delivered. If you’re looking for a seamless smart switch and mesh WiFi combination, I’d strongly recommend looking at other brands.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2025
reviews.title: Laggy and unresponsive

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: These are awesome. I added some in ceiling lights and needed an additional switch. Used these to add some modern controls and make them smart. Now I can turn lights on and off remotely, put them on a schedule if needed and just manage them if a child forgets to turn any one of them off. Well worth the cost and time.

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: I originally wrote that this product "is SO irritating. I didn't figure this out until after a very long time of installation frustration" and that "the description should be clearer". I remain convinced that the instructions leave much, much to be desired. BEFORE installing these, first go to YouTube videos that explain how three-way switches work and the installation method for these in a "stand alone" position. You'll save yourself hours. Kasa needs to get its act together on the instruction side of things, but the product is solid. I literally wasted hours and hours before doing that.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2025
reviews.title: UPDATED: Bad instructions, but decent switches

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: Pair of 3-way switches appears to work fine. However, no instructions. Video is not very enlightening. However, largest problem is that the switch housing prevents it from being installed in standard 4" steel electrical boxes. So, why is this a problem? If you have a steel electrical box (common in basements and garages) the steel cover mounting screws are covered by the switch housing and the housing is too long to fit inside the box. The 4" box has to be removed and a larger box installed. Not impossible, but unnecessary if tp-link had reduced the plastic flange so it fits inside standard electrical boxes.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2025
reviews.title: Does not fit in 4" steel electrical boxes

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: My initial rating in 2021 was 5 stars easy due to the price and ease of installation. I am finally able to write a follow up after having the 3-way wifi setup installed in multiple rooms since fall of 2021. Since then, 2 different 3 way switches (2 out of 4 in the pairs) have gone into constant on/off mode. The switch turns itself on and off continually and all the lights its connected to on and off. This is happening RAPIDLY -- maybe 2 on/off cycles every second! No amount of Restarts or Resets of the switch resolve the issue. All devices have the latest firmware. Granted, the warranty is only 2 years for these devices and they tend to crap out on the dot every 3 years, but is having to replace 1 of the 2 switches every 3 years worth it considering a traditional 3-way switch works until the rest of time?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025
reviews.title: 3-way switch rapid on/off flickers lights after 3 years

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: Works great, make sure to purchase this hs210 if you have a red trip wire and the light is controlled from two switches. I bought the hs200 first which only does a single switch and didn’t work.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2025
reviews.title: Works great with Alexa

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: Jobert was able to help me isolate issue quickly and courteously. Short answer for others that are having Wi-Fi connection issues....Change your WiFi setting to the Kasa/TP switch. Once configured the WiFi will default back to your home setting.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2025
reviews.title: WiFi connection issues

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: Ok so keep in mind you need to know a little bit about wires / travel wires to install this. Took a bit of googling but was able to get it working. I ended up splitting the set on 2 3way switches instead of both on one. The only drawback back to this is if turned off with the manual switch the app may not pick up they are off. No big deal hit the button again. Love TP link! Replacing all my switches etc as I go and they only get better as I go.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2025
reviews.title: Great product!

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: I am very pleased with the quality of this product. I would suggest doing research on how to install and test f your not comfortable, hire a professional. I was able to install and connect with the KASA app. Very user friendly.

reviews.title: Works great. Good quality

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: Simple install, worked flawlessly as a mechanical switch, but I had to get in touch with customer service to complete my install because one step, linking to Wi-Fi, was absent in the online and in the box instructions. I have to say that the customer service rep, Paul, was incredibly efficient and was able to immediately get me to appropriately set up the equipment, which now works just fine. Very reasonable price, not needing to use a hub is excellent, and their customer service was outstanding.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2025
reviews.title: Needed customer service for setup

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Switch HS210 KIT, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required, White,2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: I’ve had these switches installed on my home for about 2 years now. They’ve been great! Installation was easy and the integration with the Kasa app is seamless. At random times they disconnect from my internet for some reason, but it has only happened a handful of times. Overall, pretty satisfied and would buy again.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2025
reviews.title: Great smart switches! It’s been 2 years now.
